metadata.Title: CVE-2023-1233 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
Insufficient policy enforcement in Resource Timing in Google Chrome priorto 111.0.5563.64 allowed an attacker who convinced a user to install amalicious extension to obtain potentially sensitive information from APIvia a crafted Chrome Extension. (Chromium security severity: Low)

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-1233` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 111.0.5563.64-0ubuntu0.18.04.5
chromium-browser-l10n - 111.0.5563.64-0ubuntu0.18.04.5
chromium-chromedriver - 111.0.5563.64-0ubuntu0.18.04.5
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 111.0.5563.64-0ubuntu0.18.04.5
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 111.0.5563.64-0ubuntu0.18.04.5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '111.0.5563.64-0ubuntu0.18.04.5').
